Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggeringÂ $4.1 billionÂ in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total ofÂ 3,726 sales transactionsÂ were documented, with sales dominating the figures atÂ $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

ğŸ§¡ Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, Iâ€™ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers â€” especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. ğŸ“ You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) â€” but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often donâ€™t say out loud â€” about working across power, pressure, and peopleâ€™s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. Iâ€™ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. Iâ€™ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.âš–ï¸ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.ğŸ“š Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.ğŸ’¡ Invest early â€” and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:ğŸ’¸ Budgeting for you matters â€” especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.â³ Missed deadlines cost more than time â€” they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.ğŸ“£ Communication isnâ€™t optional â€” itâ€™s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.ğŸ§  Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.ğŸ“‘ Deposits and contracts are valid â€” but so is delivery. You canâ€™t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can â€” with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.ğŸ§¡ Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Letâ€™s keep building better, together.âœ¨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. âœ¨ Employers deserve more than stress. ğŸ§¡ Together, we can build environments where both sides win.ğŸ”— Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

ğŸ§¡ Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, Iâ€™ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers â€” especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. ğŸ“ You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) â€” but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often donâ€™t say out loud â€” about working across power, pressure, and peopleâ€™s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. Iâ€™ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. Iâ€™ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.âš–ï¸ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.ğŸ“š Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.ğŸ’¡ Invest early â€” and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:ğŸ’¸ Budgeting for you matters â€” especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.â³ Missed deadlines cost more than time â€” they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.ğŸ“£ Communication isnâ€™t optional â€” itâ€™s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.ğŸ§  Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.ğŸ“‘ Deposits and contracts are valid â€” but so is delivery. You canâ€™t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can â€” with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.ğŸ§¡ Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Letâ€™s keep building better, together.âœ¨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. âœ¨ Employers deserve more than stress. ğŸ§¡ Together, we can build environments where both sides win.ğŸ”— Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

ğŸ§¡ Freelance Exchange taught me a lot. Here's the honest part.Over the last 10 years, Iâ€™ve worked as both a freelancer and someone hiring freelancers â€” especially from equity-deserving communities. And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. ğŸ“ You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) â€” but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often donâ€™t say out loud â€” about working across power, pressure, and peopleâ€™s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. Iâ€™ve missed deadlines too. What matters is honest communication. Iâ€™ve been lucky to work with partners like A New Direction who led with care, not punishment.âš–ï¸ Many freelancers face systemic inequality. Equity is not charity. Building systems of access and support is justice.ğŸ“š Clear briefs unlock better work. Employers must scope well, pay on time, and model professionalism.ğŸ’¡ Invest early â€” and freelancers often over-deliver long-term.What freelancers need to understand about employers:ğŸ’¸ Budgeting for you matters â€” especially in small orgs. We hire instead of paying ourselves. If you want fair pay, remember: delivery and communication are part of that fairness.â³ Missed deadlines cost more than time â€” they break trust. One late task can derail reports, delay programmes, or damage partnerships.ğŸ“£ Communication isnâ€™t optional â€” itâ€™s part of the job. Up-managing is a superpower. The best freelancers check in, clarify, and flag risks early.ğŸ§  Understanding how public/third sector employers work gives you an edge.ğŸ“‘ Deposits and contracts are valid â€” but so is delivery. You canâ€™t expect full payment for half-complete work.The future of work needs both sides to do better.And we can â€” with honesty, shared values, and radical collaboration.ğŸ§¡ Deep gratitude to every freelancer, partner, funder, and teammate who shaped this work. Letâ€™s keep building better, together.âœ¨ Freelancers deserve more than gigs. âœ¨ Employers deserve more than stress. ğŸ§¡ Together, we can build environments where both sides win.ğŸ”— Case study @LocalChampionsCIC hashtag#FreelanceExchange hashtag#WeMakeChampions hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#Freelancers hashtag#InclusiveInnovation hashtag#SystemsChange hashtag#Entrepreneurship hashtag#LocalChampions

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. ğŸ“ You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) â€” but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often donâ€™t say out loud â€” about working across power, pressure, and peopleâ€™s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. ğŸ“ You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) â€” but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often donâ€™t say out loud â€” about working across power, pressure, and peopleâ€™s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.

And while I love freelancing (and freelancers), this dual perspective has shown me just how often our expectations miss each other.We built Freelance Exchange with Good Growth Hub to bridge this gap. ğŸ“ You can read the full case study via Local Champions CIC (reshared below) â€” but today I want to be honest about the hard truths: the ones we often donâ€™t say out loud â€” about working across power, pressure, and peopleâ€™s real lives.My first freelance job was in 2014. Since then, Iâ€™ve built a six-figure consultancy career and run Local Champions CIC â€” a social enterprise and international consultancy working across the UK and Rwanda.Iâ€™ve also hired & managed over 30 freelancers in the last five years.Hereâ€™s the truth: itâ€™s still one of the hardest things I do.Not because freelancers are difficult â€” but because the relationship between freelancers & employers, especially in small orgs like ours, is rarely discussed with the mutual understanding it deserves.What employers need to understand about freelancers:ğŸ«€ Life happens â€” family, mental health, burnout. The Iâ€™ve come across numerous complaints on social media about real estate agents in Abu Dhabiâ€”ranging from unresponsiveness and lack of professionalism to outright scams. Unfortunately, these negative experiences can make the property search stressful for expats and investors. To help you navigate the market with confidence, Iâ€™m sharing essential tips on how to find a legitimate and reliable real estate agent in Abu Dhabi. Finding the right property in Abu Dhabi starts with finding the right agent. But how do you ensure youâ€™re working with a legitimate and trustworthy real estate broker? Here are some key tips:âœ… Check Their License â€“ Every broker in Abu Dhabi must be licensed by the Department of Municipalities and Transport (DMT). Ask for their broker card or verify their registration with their agency.âœ… Use Verified Platforms Like Property Finder â€“ Platforms such as Property Finder UAE list verified agents and agencies, making it easier to connect with licensed professionals. Always check the agentâ€™s profile and credentials before engaging.âœ… Research Their Reputation â€“ Read online reviews, ask for referrals from other expats, and check their past client experiences. A reputable agent should have a solid track record.âœ… Work with Established Agencies â€“ Choose brokers from well-known, reputable real estate firms that comply with Abu Dhabiâ€™s real estate regulations. This reduces the risk of dealing with unlicensed or unreliable agents.ğŸš¨ Red Flags to Avoid:âŒ Agents who pressure you into making quick decisionsâŒ Deals that seem too good to be trueâŒ Requests for cash payments without official receipts or contractsâŒ Lack of transparency on fees, terms, and market conditionsA legitimate and knowledgeable broker will guide you through the process with transparency and professionalism, ensuring a smooth and secure property transaction.Respect Goes Both Ways: The Clientâ€™s Role in a Successful Property SearchFinding the right home or investment isnâ€™t just about choosing the right agentâ€”itâ€™s also about how you, as a client, engage in the process. Many buyers and tenants unknowingly make the mistake of working with multiple agents at once, or even calling the landlordâ€™s office, thinking it will speed things up. But hereâ€™s the truth: a good agent can sense when theyâ€™re just one of many, and that lack of exclusivity often leads to a lack of commitment.Real estate agents dedicate time, effort, and expertise to finding you the best options. When you spread your search across multiple agents, no one truly takes ownership of your needs. Instead, if you find a trustworthy, hardworking agent, respect their time, value their guidance, and allow them to do what they do bestâ€”find you the right home.Trust the process, and in return, youâ€™ll get the commitment and results you deserve.What are your thoughts on this? Share your experiences.

In the bustling metropolis of Dubai, the real estate sector continues to soar to new heights, much like the iconic Burj Khalifa piercing the sky. Last week, the market recorded a staggeringÂ $4.1 billionÂ in transactions, showcasing the city's resilience and allure as a global investment hub.Between March 10 and March 14, a total ofÂ 3,726 sales transactionsÂ were documented, with sales dominating the figures atÂ $3.1 billion. This remarkable activity reflects not just numbers, but the vibrant pulse of a city that never sleeps, where dreams are built brick by brick. As of now, in general free zones companies cannot operate in mainland area.However, recently a reform has been introduced under the Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025 Concerning the Regulation of Practice of Activities by Free Zone Establishments within the Emirate of Dubai with the aim to allow free zone companies or establishment (the â€œEstablishmentâ€) to operate in Mainland in the Emirate of Dubai (the â€œEmirateâ€).The provisions of this Resolution apply to Establishments that intend to conduct their activities beyond the Free Zone, excluding financial establishments licensed to operate within the Dubai International Financial Centre.An Establishment may conduct its activities outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate, provided it obtains the permit by the Department of Economy and Tourism of Dubai (the â€œDepartmentâ€) and through for example a license for establishing a branch within the Emirate or a permit to conduct certain activities within the Emirate.In order for the Department to grant a license for setting up a branch for the Establishment in the Emirate or to grant a permit, certain conditions shall be met, including for example:- the Establishment must submit an application to the Department as per the relevant approved forms, procedures, and mechanisms for establishing a branch or obtaining the permit for the intended activity;- prior approval of Licensing Authority (the Authority of the Free Zone that granted the license to the Establishment) is mandatory;- the approval of any relevant government authorities overseeing the activity to be conducted outside the Free Zone and within the Emirate is mandatory;- certain documents such as copy of the articles of incorporation and of the license of the Establishment shall be submitted.To be noted that:- the activity to be conducted within the Emirate must be included in the list of activities that the Department will issue;- license for branches will have a validity of one year and can be renewed, while permit will be granted for a period not exceeding six (6) months;- the Establishment's branch shall not have a legal personality and shall not be regarded as independent from the parent Establishment.
